image.altText: A child sitting on the shoulders of a person wearing lion face paint.

props.synopsis: Two non-Victorian clubs are set to meet in the 2024 AFL Grand Final, prompting thousands of fans to travel interstate in the hopes of seeing their team win the premiership.

title.children: Fans flock to Melbourne's AFL grand final parade ahead of Swans and Lions blockbuster

image.altText: A man watching football having an angry reaction

props.synopsis: The AFL and NRL grand finals are a time of celebration for many, but experts warn it can be a period of heightened risk for domestic violence. Berry Street, a domestic violence support service, is preparing for a busy weekend, after experiencing a 30 to 40 per cent increase in demand during the 2023 grand final weekend.

title.children: Footy, fans and family violence: Why experts say major sporting events are the 'perfect storm'

image.altText: Nelson Asofa-Solomona shouts as he talks to Melbourne Storm teammate Jahrome Hughes during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Nelson Asofa-Solomona spends the first 10 minutes on the sidelines as Melbourne and Sydney face off in the finals for the fifth time in 10 years as they bid for a spot in the NRL grand final. Follow live.

title.children: Storm run riot after firebrand sin-binned in first tackle of preliminary final against Roosters

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HALF-TIME: Storm lead 22-6 after early sin-bin
THE STORM GO TRYLINE TO TRYLINE!!

image.altText: Cigdem Aslan smiles, standing in a suburban garden beside red and pink flowers.

props.synopsis: The daughter of an Australian woman arrested in TÃ¼rkiye is calling on the federal government to help bring her mother home, saying the accusations against her are "categorically false".

title.children: Daughter pleads for release of Australian woman arrested in TÃ¼rkiye over alleged terrorism links

image.altText: Hundreds of people form a circle around an image of a whale tale made of seaweed on the beach

props.synopsis: Three-line email calls off an international conglomerate's bid to conduct Australia's largest seismic blast survey in search of gas in the Otway Basin.

title.children: Opponents celebrate as plan abandoned for major seismic testing off Victoria

image.altText: A man in a light blue singlet sitting in front of plants.

props.synopsis: Perry Kouroumblis is not the first person to face a high-profile extradition from Italy to Australia. Here's how the process is expected to play out.

title.children: Watch ðŸ“º| How the extradition of Easey Street accused from Italy to Australia might unfold

image.altText: A large banner in front of a yard gate reading "It's your park and native wildlife"

props.synopsis: Some residents in Melbourneâ€™s south-east are against a proposed school development, fearing it will risk native wildlife in Lysterfield Lake National Park.Â

title.children: Proposed school development sparks wildlife concerns in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Darcy Fort training with the Brisbane Lions in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions name Darcy Fort in place of injured ruck Oscar McInerney for Saturday's grand final, while Taylor Adams fails in his bid to make the Swans' extended squad.

title.children: Lions confirm ruck replacement for grand final as Swans make call on Adams

image.altText: Brodie Grundy and Oscar McInerney contest for the ball during an AFL match between the Sydney Swans and Brisbane Lions

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans will take on the Brisbane Lions on Saturday, with Katy Perry providing pre-show entertainment at the MCG.

title.children: The 2024 AFL grand final has almost arrived. Here's how to watch and what to expect

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers talks National Accounts

props.synopsis: After days of speculation over who ordered public servants to take another look at the tax breaks, the treasurer has spoken up.Â

title.children: Jim Chalmers concedes he asked Treasury for negative gearing modelling

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and NDRC Chairman Zheng Shanjie sit at a wide desk in a formal meeting room.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers meets with his Chinese counterpart to discuss the country's flagging economy and how that may impact Australia, as well as some lingering trade bans and the test-firing of an intercontinental ballistic missile.

title.children: He's the first Australian treasurer to visit Beijing in 7 years. So what did Chalmers's trip achieve?

image.altText: A graphic showing a microscopic photo of the mpox virus and a red arrow

props.synopsis: Between July and September 26, the number of mpox cases increased by more than 570 per cent to a total of 724. One way to address to growing number of cases is increasing vaccination rates.

title.children: Mpox spread accelerates in Australia with 85pc of this year's cases recorded since July

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Optus failed to provide honest and credible communication during last year's phone outage, and should be forced to provide fair compensation in the event of another, a Senate committee has found.

title.children: Optus failed to honestly communicate in 'potentially dangerous' mass mobile and internet outage

image.altText: A pink funeral booklet that has CHARLOTTE O'BRIEN in the title

props.synopsis: Charlotte O'Brien was 12 years old when she took her own life earlier this month. Her parents want her story to be shared.

title.children: Parents honour 'beautiful and kind' daughter who took her own life after alleged bullying

image.altText: Aerial shot of a group of houses, all of which have solar panels on their roof

props.synopsis: For decades, a big risk to Australia's electricity system has been excessive demand in summer. Now, it is excessive supply in spring.

title.children: Market operator issues first-ever low-demand warning as solar 'juggernaut' risks grid overload

image.altText: The word Cranbrook in gold on a sandstone column at the gates of a school.

props.synopsis: The independent review into the prestigious Sydney school was announced after the ABC's Four Corners exposed allegations of a toxic culture and revealed the former headmaster kept a teacher on despite knowing he sent graphic emails to a former female student.

title.children: Cranbrook School apologises for 'past failings' after review into child safety issues

image.altText: A man standing in a crowd and waves

props.synopsis: Japan's next prime minister will be maverick regional politician Shigeru Ishiba, after the ruling Liberal Democratic Party elected him its new leader following the news Prime Minister Fumio Kishida would step down.

title.children: Japan's former defence chief who tried and failed to be prime minister many times finally wins the top job

image.altText: Melania Trump wearing a black dress and dark sunglasses. Donald Trump's silhouette is visible in the reflection of her glasses

props.synopsis: Former first lady Melania Trump sits down for a rare interview in which she reviews Donald Trump's political record and recounts the moment she learned her husband had been shot in an assassination attempt.Â

title.children: Some strong tweets, but everything else is great': The takeaways from Melania Trump's sit-down interview with Fox

image.altText: A satelitte image shows cranes at shipyard in Wuhan Shi, China

props.synopsis: One of China's nuclear-powered submarines sank earlier this year, a potential embarrassment for Beijing as it seeks to expand its military capabilities.

title.children: Senior US defence official claims Chinese nuclear-powered attack submarine sank earlier this year

image.altText: A close up of a pile of SIM cards lying on a table, overlapping and showing their metal contacts

props.synopsis: A Chinese national charged over an elaborate phishing scam involving millions of fraudulent text messages claiming to be from agencies including Medicare, Centrelink, and Australia Post was trying to avoid detection, a court has heard.

title.children: Chinese national charged over scam involving 4.9 million fraudulent texts living unlawfully in Australia

image.altText: Women in blue suits holding red folders throw white documents in the air

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Supreme Court quashes a tribunal decision that would have forced a museum to allow men to enter its women-only "Ladies' Lounge".

title.children: 'Women are better than men': Mona curator celebrates after Supreme Court win for ladies lounge

image.altText: A moving satellite image of a hurricane moving over the coast of Florida.

props.synopsis: Helene prompted hurricane and flash flood warnings extending far beyond the coast up into northern Georgia and western North Carolina.

title.children: Hurricane Helene makes landfall in north-western Florida as forecasters warn of 'nightmare' storm surge

image.altText: A young couple sitting at a table and smiling.

props.synopsis: Indigenous rights pioneer Joyce Clague persevered through early life on a mission and a childhood of racism and discrimination to become an international activist.

title.children: Tributes flow for First Nations activist with 'fire in the belly'

image.altText: A graphic illustrating a social network of the pro-chemical lobby

props.synopsis: This social network, hosting figureheads of the pro-chemical lobby, can't be tracked down in a Google search. It collates "wiki dossiers" of vocal opponents of pesticides and chemicals along with advice on how to influence public discourse. Among its members are high-profile Australian industry players.Â

title.children: High-profile Australian industry players part of invite-only social network where pro-chemical lobby shares 'wiki' dossiers of known critics

image.altText: A woman and man in their 60s smile for a selfie in front of a sign that says 'Welcome to Texas'.

props.synopsis: As an accessible insight into trans lives, and possibly the first trans film some will encounter when browsing Netflix, Will & Harper succeeds in its emotional honesty.

title.children: Will Ferrell's new Netflix doco takes on transphobia in the US, but it's really about friendship

image.altText: A soldier covers his ears as a tank explodes

props.synopsis: Israel has been giving strong signals it plans to launch a ground invasion of Lebanon as part of its war against Hezbollah, but whether it has learnt from its last military campaign in the country remains to be seen.

title.children: What Israel can learn from its 2006 ground invasion of Lebanon, which 'failed completely'

image.altText: An elderly Japanese man wearing a green vest and hat sits on a chair looking directly at the camera with a pensive expression

props.synopsis: Human rights groups call for the end of the death penalty in Japan after Iwao Hakamada, who spent 45 years in solitary confinement on death row, is found to have been wrongfully convicted of murder.

title.children: Japanese man's acquittal after 48 years on death row puts nation's death penalty policy under spotlight

image.altText: Race winner Daniel Ricciardo screams in excitement standing on the top step of the podium as wine is sprayed in celebration

props.synopsis: Daniel Ricciardo's time in Formula 1 appears over and it ended with a whimper. But the Australian should always be remembered as an outstanding driver whose contribution to F1 makes him a great of the sport.

title.children: Forget the sad ending, Daniel Ricciardo should be remembered as one of his generation's best drivers and an icon of F1

image.altText: Niecy Nash-Betts as a detective looking up in the air, a frightened/surprised expression on her face, shining a torch

props.synopsis: NFL tight end Travis Kelce is being praised for his acting debut in Grotesquerie, a series about a detective who accepts the help of a nun and journalist as she investigates a series of unsettling crimes.

title.children: Niecy Nash-Betts stars as detective investigating unsettling crimes in series also featuring Travis Kelce

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: For many of us, COVID has become just a bad memory, despite its lasting and mixed legacies. But experts are urging that we learn from our mistakes and plan ahead.Â

title.children: Pandemics don't give much notice of their arrival â€” so Albanese is being urged to get ready

image.altText: A composite image

props.synopsis: Righto then, smarty pants, test yourself.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Surprise Aria nods, Pesto the penguin, and a new Socceroos coach

image.altText: Fijiâ€™s President Ratu Wiliame Katonivere speaking at the United Nations

props.synopsis: China has insisted the test was "not directed at any country or target" but it has still generated considerable unease in the Pacific.Â Â

title.children: China's launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile criticised by Fiji, Australia, Palau and New Zealand

props.synopsis: High in the Chilean desert, the Extremely Large Telescope is taking shape. It promises sharper views of space than we've ever seen â€” but will Australian astronomers be able to use it?

title.children: 'We will not fail': The Extremely Large Telescope in Chile is astronomy's next big thing â€” if it works

image.altText: Adam Driver in Francis Ford Coppola's Megalopolis

props.synopsis: For better or worse, Frances Ford Coppola's long-awaited passion project featuring a laundry list of high-profile actors has finally hit cinemas.

title.children: Megalopolis took more than 40 years and $120m to make. It's been worth every bit of trouble
